data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn't move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

attacks.name: Stinky Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: Close examination of its large eyes reveals that each eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.

attacks.name: Bye-Bye Heal
attacks.text: Heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Tangrowth
data.flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crosswise Whip
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Vileplume
data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

abilities.name: Disgusting Pollen
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Downer Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Ledyba
data.flavorText: They are timid and grow uneasy when not in a swarm with others of their kind. The pattern on their backs differs slightly from one to another.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.text: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

attacks.name: Pitch
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Ledian
data.flavorText: While it's believed that starlight provides it with energy, this Pokémon also loves to eat berries. In the daytime, it curls up in the grass to sleep.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Pansage
data.flavorText: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

data.name: Simisage
data.flavorText: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

attacks.name: Leaf Supply
attacks.text: You may attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Araquanid
data.flavorText: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

attacks.name: Bubble Net
attacks.text: Energy can't be attached to the Defending Pokémon from your opponent's hand during their next turn.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

data.name: Golisopod-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crossing Cut-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.

abilities.name: Wimp Out
abilities.text: During your first turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Ho-Oh-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Phoenix Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Phoenix Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Eternal Flame-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 in any combination of Fire Pokémon-GX or Fire Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Charizard-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Storm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Out-GX
attacks.text: Discard the top 10 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

attacks.name: Flare Recharge
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Heatmor
data.flavorText: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.

attacks.name: Odor Sleuth
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Salazzle-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Diabolical Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Prize card you have taken.

attacks.name: Queen's Haze-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Turtonator
data.flavorText: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Ninetales
data.flavorText: It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.

abilities.name: Luminous Barrier
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix
data.flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: A tale is told of a town that angered Gyarados. Before the sun rose the next day, flames utterly consumed the town, leaving not a trace behind.

attacks.name: Venting Anger
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Magikarp in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Splash Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you'll soon grow tired of seeing them.

attacks.name: Splashing Dodge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Kingdra
data.flavorText: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.

attacks.name: Brine
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tornado Shot
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Marill
data.flavorText: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry, even when it plays in the water.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Azumarill
data.flavorText: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of living things on riverbeds.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from the attacks of your opponent's Fire or Water Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Simipour
data.flavorText: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

attacks.name: Aqua Reflect
attacks.text: Move a Water Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.

data.name: Bruxish
data.flavorText: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.

attacks.name: Gnash Teeth
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Synchronoise
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that shares a type with your opponent's Active Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Tapu Fini-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tapu Storm-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tapu Fini-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tapu Storm-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: It unleashes electric shocks that can reach 100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out even an Indian elephant.

abilities.name: Evoshock
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Electivire
data.flavorText: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

attacks.name: Aqua Shock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

attacks.name: Small Appetite
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon's maximum HP is 100 or more, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Eelektross
data.flavorText: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Vacuum Bolt
attacks.text: You may do 80 more damage. If you do, this attack does 80 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Togedemaru
data.flavorText: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.

attacks.name: Electrosmash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Seviper
data.flavorText: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.text: Put 1 more damage counter on your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Duskull
data.flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

attacks.name: Dark Guidance
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.

data.name: Dusclops
data.flavorText: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.

attacks.name: Night Roam
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Slowking
data.flavorText: A poisonous bite reacted with its system, blessing it with the enhanced intellect of a genius. It has full control of its psychic powers.

attacks.name: Drift Ashore
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Unarmed
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, ignore all Energy in this attack's cost.

data.name: Wobbuffet
data.flavorText: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.

attacks.name: Shadowy Knot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Croagunk
data.flavorText: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Dusknoir
data.flavorText: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

abilities.name: Dark Invitation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent reveal their hand. Put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench, and put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Venipede
data.flavorText: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Toxicroak
data.flavorText: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Boost
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove that Special Condition from this Pokémon.

data.name: Whirlipede
data.flavorText: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Espurr
data.flavorText: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

attacks.name: Perplexing Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon's Weakness is now Psychic until the end of your next turn. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

data.name: Scolipede
data.flavorText: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Meowstic
data.flavorText: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck to dust.

attacks.name: Allure
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Hand Kinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each card in your hand.

data.name: Necrozma-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Light's End
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Colorless Pokémon.

attacks.name: Prismatic Burst
attacks.text: Discard all Psychic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 60 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Black Ray-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Sandygast
data.flavorText: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Palossand
data.flavorText: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dust Storm
attacks.text: Discard all cards from both Active Pokémon.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

data.name: Rhydon
data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Megahorn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Machamp-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Bedrock Breaker
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Muscle Punch-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rhyperior
data.flavorText: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.

abilities.name: Toppling Wind
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Rock Wrecker
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Lunatone
data.flavorText: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.

abilities.name: Heal Block
abilities.text: If you have Solrock in play, Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be healed.

data.name: Solrock
data.flavorText: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Solar Heat
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It can discern the physical and emotional states of people, Pokémon, and other natural things from the shape of their aura waves.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: Not only does it perceive auras, but it has also gained the power to control them. It employs them in battle.

abilities.name: Stance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon until the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Sawk
data.flavorText: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.

attacks.name: Quick Guard
attacks.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. This Pokémon can't use Quick Guard during your next turn.

attacks.name: Brick Break
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance or any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Crabrawler
data.flavorText: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.

data.name: Crabominable
data.flavorText: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.

attacks.name: Gutsy Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself for each damage counter on it.

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Lycanroc
data.flavorText: The more intimidating the opponent it faces, the more this Pokémon's blood boils. It will attack with no regard for its own safety.

attacks.name: Dangerous Claws
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Lycanroc
data.flavorText: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.

data.name: Mudbray
data.flavorText: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Mudsdale
data.flavorText: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.

attacks.name: Kick Away
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vigorous Dash
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself. This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Passimian
data.flavorText: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.

attacks.name: Intentional Grounding
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card from your hand. If you don't, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Marshadow-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadow Hunt
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Basic Pokémon in your discard pile. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Peerless Hundred Blows-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Rattata
data.flavorText: With its incisors, it gnaws through doors and infiltrates people's homes. Then, with a twitch of its whiskers, it steals whatever food it finds.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Bite attack's base damage is 60.

data.name: Alolan Raticate
data.flavorText: It forms a group of Rattata, which it assumes command of. Each group has its own territory, and disputes over food happen often.

attacks.name: Enhanced Fang
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Alolan Grimer
data.flavorText: A Grimer, which had been brought in to solve a problem with garbage, developed over time into this form.

attacks.name: Division
attacks.text: Search your deck for Alolan Grimer and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Slippery Sludge
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Alolan Muk-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Chemical Breath
attacks.text: This attack does 70 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tri Hazard-GX
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

attacks.name: Rule of Evil
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to each Pokémon that has an Ability (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Darkrai
data.flavorText: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dark Raid
attacks.text: If your opponent has already used their GX attack, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: It has a cunning yet savage disposition. It waits for parents to leave their nests, and then it sneaks in to steal their eggs.

attacks.name: Hone Claws
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Slash attack's base damage is 80.

data.name: Darkrai-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restoration
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. Then, attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Cleave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Dead End-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, that Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Darkrai-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restoration
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. Then, attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Cleave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Dead End-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, that Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Malamar
data.flavorText: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Energy Slosh
attacks.text: You may move all Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Gardevoir-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Secret Spring
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fairy Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Infinite Force
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Twilight-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle 10 cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.

data.name: Diancie
data.flavorText: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

attacks.name: Sparkling Wish
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Diamond Storm
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Fairy Pokémon.

data.name: Cutiefly
data.flavorText: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

data.name: Morelull
data.flavorText: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

data.name: Shiinotic
data.flavorText: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.

attacks.name: Strength Sap
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Noivern-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Distort
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Sonic Volume
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Special Energy cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Boomburst-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Zygarde
data.flavorText: This is Zygarde's form at times when it uses its overwhelming power to suppress those who endanger the ecosystem.

attacks.name: Core Enforcer
attacks.text: Discard a Darkness Energy and a Fairy Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Ribombee
data.flavorText: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.

abilities.name: Honey Gather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk. At night, it wanders the city in search of loose change.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Persian
data.flavorText: It has a violent temperament. It will attack anything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp claws inflict deep wounds.

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 60 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Porygon
data.flavorText: Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created, utilizing the latest technology of the time.

attacks.name: Code Check
attacks.text: Look at 1 of your opponent's face-down Prize cards.

data.name: Porygon2
data.flavorText: For the purposes of planetary development, Porygon was updated with the most cutting-edge technology available.

attacks.name: Calculate
attacks.text: Look at the top 6 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.flavorText: In order to create a more advanced Pokémon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.

abilities.name: Initialize
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.flavorText: In order to create a more advanced Pokémon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.

abilities.name: Initialize
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.name: Noctowl
data.flavorText: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Night Raid
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard a Pokémon from it.

data.name: Hoothoot
data.flavorText: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.

attacks.name: See Through
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

data.name: Bouffalant
data.flavorText: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

attacks.name: Bouffant Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

data.name: Noibat
data.flavorText: They live in pitch black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Bewear
data.flavorText: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

attacks.name: Mix-Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Stufful
data.flavorText: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

attacks.name: Baby-Doll Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Bodybuilding Dumbbells
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Stage 1 Pokémon this card is attached to gets +40 HP.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Acerola
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Escape Rope
rules: Each player switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon. Your opponent switches first. (If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, that player doesn't switch Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Guzma
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. If you do, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Acerola
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Guzma
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. If you do, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kiawe
rules: Search your deck for up to 4 Fire Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. Your turn ends.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kiawe
rules: Search your deck for up to 4 Fire Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. Your turn ends.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lana
rules: Heal 50 damage from each of your Pokémon that has any Water Energy attached to it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Mount Lanakila
rules: The Retreat Cost of each Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) is Colorless more.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Olivia
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon-GX, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rotom Dex Poké Finder Mode
rules: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put them back in any order or shuffle them into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sophocles
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, draw 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Plumeria
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Po Town
rules: Whenever any player plays a Pokémon from their hand to evolve 1 of their Pokémon, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Wicke
rules: Each player counts the cards in their hand, shuffles those cards into their deck, then draws that many cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Salazzle-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Diabolical Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Prize card you have taken.

attacks.name: Queen's Haze-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Weakness Policy
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Wishful Baton
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, move up to 3 basic Energy cards from that Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Golisopod-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crossing Cut-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tapu Fini-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tapu Storm-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Marshadow-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadow Hunt
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of Basic Pokémon in your discard pile. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Peerless Hundred Blows-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Twilight-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle 10 cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ho-Oh-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Phoenix Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Phoenix Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Eternal Flame-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 in any combination of Fire Pokémon-GX or Fire Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Necrozma-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Light's End
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Colorless Pokémon.

attacks.name: Prismatic Burst
attacks.text: Discard all Psychic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 60 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Black Ray-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Machamp-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut

attacks.name: Bedrock Breaker
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Lycanfang-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Chemical Breath
attacks.text: This attack does 70 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tri Hazard-GX
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Darkrai-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restoration
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. Then, attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Cleave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Dead End-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, that Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Gardevoir-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Secret Spring
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fairy Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Infinite Force
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Twilight-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle 10 cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bodybuilding Dumbbells
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Stage 1 Pokémon this card is attached to gets +40 HP.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Choice Band
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon-GX or Active Pokémon-EX (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Escape Rope
rules: Each player switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon. Your opponent switches first. (If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, that player doesn't switch Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Multi Switch
rules: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
